title: Ghost Reflection SMB privilege escalation via orphaned SPNs
summary: Ghost Reflection chains orphaned HOST/CIFS service principal names with Kerberos reflection to coerce SMB authentication back to an attacker-controlled host and escalate to SYSTEM when SMB signing is disabled.
notes: Requires a ghost SPN mapped to a retired account and the ability to register DNS for the orphaned hostname.
Attackers replay Kerberos authentication captured via ghost SPNs against an SMB service lacking signing to gain elevated privileges.
